comments.text: Great spot to find drivers to Bursa and further. Found two guys who were willing to directly drive us to our place for the night and invited us for dinner as well.
Go on the ferry and ask truck drivers, the first one took me!
We were at the ferry with our backpacks and a sign to Bursa and a truck driver came to us and tell us that we can go with him
We hitchhiked just in front of the ferry terminal and got a ride to Yalova. Just ask some drivers.
Very easy to find someone to Yalova but also Bursa and Izmir. best spot to get out from Istanbul!

Easy to get to Çildir where you can continue to Aktaş border. The fruit seller told me it's common to find hitchhikers. I arrived here from Kars where i told the minibus driver to drop me at Arpaçay intersection, but he wisely took me here to catch more traffic. The view is just magic!
easy to get to Ardahan or further, if you go further than Ardahan ask the driver to drop you off before the junction
While having lunch and enjoying the view already 5 cars offered to take me to Ardahan. After lunch it took 5 minutes.
out of Kars to Ardahan or Cildir lake
only way to Ani
it's easy to get a ride to Ani ruins.

I used a panel to Antalya but no one took me for 20min so I used my finger and someone took me to Denizli than I found another car directly to Antalya.
the best spot to leave Pamukkale direction of Denizli and Antalya
Good spot for Denizli. One man picked us up and brought us directly to the main highway, direction Dinar/Afyonkarahisar/Konya.
Sign for Antalya, first ride picked us up (girl and guy) for a lift to Denizli.  Great spot.
As usual: walk to the edge of town and start hitchhiking. Not a problem to get a ride to Denizli, from where you can go to any direction.
Better walk a few 100 m down the road, but still make the money issue clear. Otherwise good spot.
Make the money issue clear here!
There are many taxis and many drivers that want money, but we got a lift by a bus for free to Batumi. There are also a lot of marshrutkas.
Great spot to get a lift to Batumi. There is a cash machine aswell by the way.
Great spot to go to Göreme, got a ride after just 5 minutes, it's easy for cars to see and stop for you
At the traffic light, it's easy for people!

Initially I was sceptical because it's on the highway but it's a very good spot with indeed a lot of parking spot. I would suggest if you are going to Izmir, try to take a direct ride, because in my case the driver left me directly on the highway near Germencik and it was very uncomfortable.

Directions : Izmir/Istanbul or Mugla/South
Entrance of the motorway (follow the green signs with "Izmir"
20min by foot from the city center.
Big parking before the entrance of the motorway, easy to stop here.

Picked up immediately all the way to konya.
Take bus SA19 from Antalya, small white dolmus, cash only, 75 liras per person.
Anywhere along this road for hitching in either direction.  Waited seconds.
bus stop has large space, to Diyarbakir
Good spot, got a ride to Batman in 10 minutes.
Very quickly got a ride with a truck to the boarder, plenty of room to pull over
Used it for Edirne after coming from Istanbul, took 10 mins [Blog Post](http://www.hobospirit.com/hitchhiking-out-of-istanbul-towards-edirne/)
Good spot for Edirne on main road D100.
Easy pickings.  Waited a few minutes max before a ride all the way to Batumi.  Just find a space for them to pull in.
We just looked for an empty space to pull over and waited.
There is the last shop before the boarder. So just ask the truck drivers or try it at the traffic light!

This is a great spot if you are going north towards Manisa and Istanbul. To get here get off at "Evka-3" station (last station of Izmir metro line) and start hitching at the gas station. There are many university students who commute between Izmir and Manisa this way and it's a usual spot for people to pick you up.
Cars go especially Manisa but you can find Balıkesir also.
To Manisa, Balıkesir, Bursa, İstanbul
Literally had 4 cars stop for me in the first 5minutes, perfect spot. LONGG straight road with large curb.
Very good spot when hitchhiking to Istanbul, on this spot you can get lifts from both cars going on highway and those avoiding going there.

Cars coming slowly, can see you from afar, tons of space to stop. Not many cars but we were picked up by first one.
Problem is getting here: only one bus, 44a, and doesn't even go by every hour.
Got ride to Nevsehir from here. It took 5 minutes to catch a car

Got dropped off here. Seems like a nice spot, with a lots of cars, but waited 2,5 hours before we got a ride to Ankara. We were standing in the end of the parking spot. The security guards where sending us away if we asked people outside the gas station/restaurant. Two guys. Sunday afternoon in February.
Huge service station on the highway towards Ankara (or Samsun-Trabzon). It's possible to talk to drivers, but probably not worthwhile if you don't speak Turkish.

The best place to go to Denizli, I hitchhiked to times from this place 
First time : I was alone, I used a panel DENIZLI. A car stoped for me in only 5min waiting 
Second time : we were two person going to Fethiye ! we didn't wait at all when we were in gaz station someone ask us directly where we are going and he took us because it was his destination we were lucky
Great place to leave Antalya in any direction, big intercection with traffic lights and gas station, good space for car to stop, got picked up by the 2nd car towards Denizli in 5min
this road looks like a motorway, but it isn't. after 10 minute we got a ride, and the driver took us to the other side of the city, to the road we needed.

I'm not exactly sure it was that spot, but this mark supposed to be for the place where you can go to walk to the salt. there are many people passing by, also for the lake, so it took 10 minute to get picked up. there is no shadow tho, and if it happens that you have to sleep around, better to go up to the hills, because by the side of the lake there were many-many big streetdogs appearing after sunset.
To go to Devrent valley, for a nice sunset.
The way to Avanos

It was really easy to go out from the city by bus #44. It took us approx. 30 minutes to the hitchhiking spot. Notice that you have to push the stop button in the bus. Otherwise the bus won't stop there, because there is not really a bus station where you start hitching from!
Direction Acsaray-Nivshehir. You can reach this place by bus #44 from city center
Here you can go to Talas easily. This way is going to Erciyes University so people are used to see hitchhikers here.
Here is the common hitchhiking point for university students. You can find a car that going to square easily.
Better to start walking down the offramp towards the tollgate and just thumb whenever a car drives by. This got me a ride to Rize (800-900 km) when I was about halfway there.
We got lift here at night in 10 minutes. Truck took us to Erzurum.
It's a great spot if you are heading to Malatya. Better to wait until you find a direct ride to Malatya rather than going to a small town inbetween.

Though not very close, it's a fairly easy and downhill walk from Ulucamii (the mosque) to here. Make sure you walk past the hospital and the gas station as many drivers either turn back around or stop at the gas station. You should be able to catch a ride at least till Kangal.
coffee shop and efetur bus port. Best places to Istanbul
Traffic Lights, autobahn connection. Best places for Istanbul, Ankara, Sakarya and Bolu

Get to the bus station for free with the service buses. Then walk under the highway on the road next to this spot, and just jump the barrier to the highway and hitchhike from there. There is space for a car to pull over just before the bridge
Got picked in less than 3 min. Very good spot to go to Nevshir or Uchisar.
to Nevshir/Göreme, I did it several times (with two friends!) and everytime in few minutes someone stopped.
Good sport and good road to Aphrodisias.
I just wanted to reach Cardak to get a normal bus to Denizli. While I was working a car just stopped and picked me up and took to the city!
Good spot to get a ride to Sumela Monastery
Got a ride fro free from a minibus. But is generally a good spot becuase cars don't go fast and there are some bus stops where they can pick you up
Got a ride to Tokat
There is a main bus staition near this highway. From here you can chose 3 direction Tokat - west, Kayseri - south or Erzurum - east
Got ride to Goreme.
Got ride to Manavgat
7 a.m. it took 10 minutes to get a car directly to Batumi
For the direction of Sivas, but either side of the road is good for hitching onwards.  A sign for Trabzor got us a lift in minutes, but you only need to stick the thumb out here.
With a thumb out, got a ride to Avanos and onto the D300 in minutes.
Anywhere along this road to hitch a ride in the direction of Kayseri and beyond.  You won't need a sign, just know where you want to go!
Good place to pull in.  Plenty of traffic heading South out of the city.
The best place to hitchhike south from Izmir. It took 1 minute to catch a car.
Directly in front of the farm Narköy, you can find cars to Izmit or to the beach in Kefken easily.
You can find cars to the next villages or to Izmit easily.
very easy to find a car that goes directly to Yalova or further.
Tollgates, parking and a litle post office. Good place to hitchhike towards Istanbul.
Good spot for hitchhiking in the direction of Askale -> Trabzon.

Good spot, we have found ride immediatelly even when it was dark.
Be careful taking this road in winter or spring when it is snowing in the mountains. The road is going thought the mountains. Our truck got stuck in March for the night in inhabitated area on the top of some hill because all the road was covered by ice (there was more cars with the same problem and already some roadside assistance car).

Good spot for hitchhiking to Kavancilar, Bingol.
You don't need to go up on the bridge to get there.
A lot of local traffic and locals offering rides for money but still we have found ride very fast.
Good place for hitchhiking in the direction of Elazig. A lot of local traffic. It is good to take a ride to the next crossroads. Beautiful views on the way to Elazir.
Good place for hithiking to Elazig. Beautiful views on the way.
Good hitchhiking spot in the direction of Adana.
Good hitchhiking spot in the direction of Adana.
Good place for hitchhiking to towards Mersin, Adana.
Good spot for hithhiking towards Guzelcamli.

Parking with some restaurmants and free wifi.
Good place to hitchhike towartds Selcuk (if some driver is going furher on the highway it is is a ood place for you to stay). We have found ride easily by asking drivers and it was already dark.
Good spot for hitchhiking to the direction of Izmir. Wide road.
Great place for geting to the european side. Drivers now that you can't walk on the bridge and they were stopping sometimes before we started to hitchhike.
Antalya çıkışının son kavşağı. Trafik ışıkları ve kavşak olmasından ötürü otostopçunun fark edilebileceği en ideal yer.
Easy to get a lift from here to Mardin
Take bus KL08 for 2TL to the last stop. walk 10m to the road, smile, get in.

Spot just after some traffic lights with traffic turning onto the coastal highway (D400). Hitch beside the road or at the gasstations.

Get here by minibus 15.
Near University is a good spot to move to the east
5 min waiting and someone will pick you up
I wait approximately 5 mins. to go back to the camping area near national park.

This is a very good spot for all directions. It took me only 5 minutes to get a lift the whole way from here to Marmaris what is about 320km. To get to this point I took the Tramway till endstation "Fatih" and walked about 1 hour along the street to this place. But I am sure there would be a bus as well.
Also a good spot in direction to istanbul
Best place to go Edirne. There are traffic lights and big free area to stop.

The guy dropped me off directly just on the highway. Pedestrians arent allowed on highways in turkey, but no matter got a ride wquite fast after 10 min waiting with a sig saying 'Bafa'. Hithchiking in Turkey is really easy, most of them are really helpful and friendly. This guy even gave me 15 turkish lira to buy me some food.

Seems like every student from Manisa Celal Bayar Üniversitesi hitchhikes from this spot to Izmir. In the meantime, there were about  6-10 people beside the road. Had a nice chat with one of them and got to Izmir with two other guys in a car. Very nice spot.
To Izmir about 15 min even night.
The same is true for direction Agri. Busy enough road, short(ish) waiting time.
Quite a busy road and nice spot if you are going to Van. You may find a direct ride.
Got a free ride from a taxi(!) all the way to Dohuk. Nice.
Quite easy to catch rides on both side of the border. Just avoid the taxis - on the Iraq-Kurdistan side you might have to make it clear before you enter a car.
Huge traffic. Easy to get a lift to the border.
it's easy to get a ride to Erzurum
the first car took me back to Kars
to Kars. my previous driver forced to stop a small truck because he knew that truck hoes my way, so i just jumped over.
from the waterfall i just walked to the big road. to Dogubeyazit
dolmus driver tried to destroy my hh but then he gave up
Took 5 minutes to get a ride back to Van.
i missed the dolmus to Midyat so i hitchhiked. Many cars stopped but they went another way so after 15 min i got a ride.
to Urfa (i went to Atatürk Dam). it's in the city, too big traffic but it worked. you should take a bus to University which is at the end of the city.

to Kahta or Adiyaman. after the sunrise walk down and wait the turist vans. with 2 rides i could go to Adiyaman fast. Hotel service buses also take you but some who takes a tour try to get money from you but at least they told me before.
Also easy to catch rides to the east from here (on the right highway I mean of course)
Mardin is 20km from here. Most vehicles will be going straight there.
use this road to get Sanliurfa not the O-52. This is commonly used way. I have hh'ed here twice and had good experiences.
To Iskenderun, Adana and Gaziantep.
Good point to get a ride to Antakya.
To Adana/Hatay
To Aksaray.
I have hitchhiked at this point twice. Although traffic flow is very fast here, I did not wait more than 15 min to ride.
Perfect spot! Nice and wide road and cars go slow. Here you can find a truck going to Iran or even further, like Turkmenistan.
Good spot for heading east towards Iran

This is the best spot for the East I've found so far. It is the way to the Black Sea region as well as to Iran and most of the Eastern areas.
Take a Dolmuş from Ulus going to "Mamak". Be careful, the only dolmuş reaching as far as this are located at the bus station next to the Julian column, that is 300m N-E of the main square with the Ataturk statue. The dolmuş will take you all the way to the highway (as for "otoban")
You can take a public bus to reach this place (Bus #317 from Bornova Metro Station) and start HHing towards east. It's better to start here than in Bornova.

Afyon is in the crossroads of big cities. What's nice here is that the main road does not go through the city, so you don't have to walk a lot. There is a crossing and a bridge somewhere around here and many cars go to Ankara. There are also a lot of way stations in Afyon, so you can check the licence plates and ask the drivers personally.

If you are HHing from Izmir to Ankara (or vice versa), you may be dropped off here by a driver going towards Kutahya. If you're HHing in Ankara direction, it is better to avoid cars going only until Usak to avoid entering the centre of the city and walking outside. It is a good HHing spot, so you can wait until you find a car that is going further.
Easy way to Antalya city center :)
Also recommend this plase :) no problem to catch the car directly to Antalya
Good spot for finding cars to Antalyia. Just after the end of the town.

Good spot to hitchike towards Antalya.
The road seems to be a motorway on the map but it's actually not, there's plenty of space for you to stand and for the car to stop all along this green road south of Konya

Just outside the city, cars are still driving slowly and there's space to stop.
Got picked up by a small truck after only 5min.

Direction Dogubeyazit, Mount Ararat, Kagizman, Kars.
Plenty of room on the side of the whole road between the town and D052. There is even a petrol station.
Just before the junction of D052 and D100 there is a police checkpoint where I was asked to stop when I passed by and the policemen invited me for tea and found me a car. They did the hitch-hiking for me in the winter.

Good spot to hitch a ride to the highway around the city. Ask the driver beforehand in which direction they are going though because it's illegal to HH on the highway and you don't want to be dropped off.
You can easily get lift to Cesme direction or Aydin direction or Bornova direction. did not wait more than 10 minutes
Really easy to get picked up for center.First car stopped for us
After lights car are starting very slowly. 3 boys, 1 girl. 5 minutes :).
2 girls, 2 boys, morning, so easy.
Here you can go to Istanbul to north, Izmir to west (in Denizli, you can go to even southern west like Mugla, Fethiye) and Antalya to south.
We were staying there in three person. Two guys and one girl. It was so easy.

Great point if you go to Antalya or Alanya. Very easily you can catch the car which goes directly to Antalya. I do not recommend you take a truck because on the way to Antalya there are a lot of mountains and with truck it will take more more time. Good luck!

To go direction Eskişehir, take the bus 121 from Kızılay direction Turkuaz-Toki (bus stop along Atatürk Bulvarı, around 100 m down from Güven Parki before a bridge above the main street). It's a long ride, at some point you'll see the signs direction Istanbul (highway), pass them and after that point you can get off anywhere. I always hitchhike at a Shell petrol station around 6 km down the road.
Just walk few hundret meters off the town to find a spot with good visibility. HH works very good, and the way is very picturesque.
İstanbul yoluna gidecekseniz 20 dakika bile sürmeden yolda olacaksınız. :)
Çarşıya giderken kullanılabilecek en uygun otostop yeri. Öğrenci yurtları olduğundan çok çabuk dururlar.
U have a direct local bus from Trabzon (3tl, 1,5E) u r away from the city, camp easy and in the morning some trucks stop to buy breakfast and so on
good spot in direction antalya or south. cars could stop, but thei are building the road new, i don't know how it is in one year.
you can also get with the metro to this point. take the metro 2 to university. go out at the last stop. the street is on your left.

If you want to hitchhike to west (Balıkesier, Çanakkale, Izmir...) here is a good spot. take any bus to Uludag University and leave the bus before you get in the campus. if you miss the bus stop, you can ask someone where is "the balıkesir road"
Also good spot. Enough space to stop a car. We got lift after 20 minutes to Yusufeli.

Our driver left us here at night, so we went by road towards Yusufeli adn we looked for sleep place in nature. When we walked on road, police car stopped adn asked us where are we going?.. so we said, that we are going to Yusufeli, thay said its dangerous. we can get  assault by locals, and then they stopped every car and asking them if they can take us :D They stopped mayor of Uzundere, and he took us to 30 km and then he gave us place to sleep and food. :D we were lucky
and how you get there?

Used it twice to get out of Istanbul and it worked perfect. Again, the same rule, just stick on to highway, after 2-3 cars you will be out of Istanbul. And stopping a car usually takes less then 5 min.
Just ask in the ferry lots of cars in it and most of them goes to İstanbul. It took less than 5 mins to find one.

Good place to catch cars going to [[Istanbul]] or [[Edirne]]
Many tourists coming by car from Izmir during summer. You can try and ask on the ferry as well.
A good spot to cross the border to go to Turkey ! you can walk on this one. A service can drop you here too, I saw someone getting out from it.
A great roundabout to hitchhike South, North, and West out of Kayseri.
The key point to go Eskisehir is 'Yasamkent' area, this area is exit of Ankara , you can reach to there by bus  from Ankara Kızılay Square.Wait near the BP Gas Station
Good spot along the main road both direction Bursa and Izmir

This is a very good spot for all directions. It took me only 5 minutes to get a lift the whole way from here to Marmaris what is about 320km. To get to this point I took the Tramway till endstation "Fatih" and walked about 1 hour along the street to this place. But I am sure there would be a bus as well.

Best place to hitchhike from Izmir Institute of Technology to Izmir, Centrum. Since drivers feel more safe-you are hitchhiking around campus- you have good luck there. It's currently most popular point,though. You can catch cars both from Karaburun and Cesme directions.
It's a good place also because there is a bus station right across the street (coffee, maybe sleep)
Beşiktaştan Şişli ve Kağıthane yönüne gitmek isteyenler için çok iyi bir nokta.
took about twenty minutes to walk here but once we did we got a ride in a couple of minutes.

there is a petroturk here, and in the lokonta there is a guy that speaks excellent self taught english and gave us çay and lentil soup. a very friendly place, and lots of cars passing, going toward Izmir and çanakkale.
Crossroads, traffic goes slow and plenty of place to stop.
From Mardin to the south. Good stop with space to stop and enough traffic.
Many trucks using the ferry, they can go anywhere. Ask them or make a sign. We waited a few seconds after midnight and got a long ride.

Possible to hitchhike to all directions, just find the road signs of your destination.
My experience on this spot was always good. But it may be tricky. heavy traffic with many local cars, but locals cars can take you further, use that chance.
Best place to go KÄ±zÄ±lay, BatÄ±kent, ÃœmitkÃ¶y, KeÃ§iÃ¶ren, KurtuluÅŸ or Maltepe. Way to Home :)
Excellent place to HH through YÃ¼zyÄ±l, AyrancÄ±, Ã‡ankaya or Dikmen. I've HHed here for 3 years, everyday ...
My Home Town :) if you're on this direction, here is a good spot to reach Ä°zmir, BalÄ±kesir or AyvalÄ±k.
Just some meters behind the roundabout there's enough space to stop cars direction Reyhanli and Syria.
Hitching north from here is super-easy.
A iranian truck dropped me here at is was quite easy to get a lift. There is enough space for cars or even for trucks to stop!

All directions.
Only way out of the city, so every car leaving Marmaris should pass here.
You can go by foot, following the signs for "Mugla"
Perfect, on the highway with lot of safe space to stop. Make sure you make sign with Antep, Antakya or Adiyman, you can catch long rides here.

Direction: Istanbul
It won't get much better than this.
Waiting time: just enough to write the sign.

Very good spot.
Many trucks are taking a break here.
Got a ride to the to the Iraqi border.
Good spot for hitchhiking eastward
Ask drivers at the gas station
On a essayé plus dans le centre d’Edirme mais aucun arrêt. Un bus dépose ici (nous on a marché 1h depuis le centre). On a attendu 3 minutes avant qu’un homme nous dépose 1 heure plus loin

Bela veturo de cigana familio venanta de Komitini al Kaŝen.
Vi eble havas bonajn 30% da homoj kun 34 numerplatoj. Sed mi akceptis la unuan kie ajn.
Direction: Nevşehir.

Direction: Nevşehir, Ankara, North.

It's on the motorway, technically illegal, but the police doesn't care. Lots of truck drivers going long distance, plenty of space to pull over.
Direction: Adana

Direction: Gaziantep.

Got dropped off here, easy to carry on to Gaziantep.

Direction: Gaziantep.

So easy to hitchhike around here. Waited almost no time at all, got a ride to Nizip and a lovely dinner.

Direction: Urfa.

This seems to be the right turn off to get to the center.

Direction: Urfa.

Not so much traffic, but cars stop.
Direction: Adıyaman.

Direction: Adıyaman, Siverek.

Very easy to get a ride down the mountain from anywhere on this road. Some times of the day the traffic is scarce, but sunset and sunrise are very popular.

They also allow you to camp next to visitor centre (or even sleep on a sofa on their cafe terrace, which is open all night.)

Direction: Nemrut.

East to get a ride to Nemrut or at least to the next turn off. Very friendly people, extremely hitchable area.

Direction: Nemrut, Adıyaman.

We didn't even stick out thumbs out and somebody waved to us and took us to the Mount Nemrut turn off.

Direction: Tatvan, West.

It was very easy for us to get a ride out of Van. The one we got after took us all the way to Midyat.

Direction: Kars, Erzurum, Van. Very easy to get a ride with one of the Turkish/Kurdish truck drivers. In our case they just chatted us up and took to Kars (could've gone with him all the way to Gaziantep, but wanted to explore the area).
Driver took us (3 males) to Ankara. Waited no more than 2 minutes. Great spot, cars were driving slowly.
First car drove me Al the way to Mardin and dropped me off exactly at my destination

Lots of trucks going long distances after border crossing. Many locals also hitchhiking under bridge and also on road towards Mardin. Better under the bridge so you get picked up first. 
Got picked up by a truck with another dude too.

Can really recommend this place. Big trucks go here for tea, and specially at night time. As Kurds are always, very helpfull and the tearoom staff was very interested in my trip and immediately helped me find someone going my way. Also many free tea's;) I think anyone can find someone going long distance at your direction at almost any time(after some hitchhiking concept explaining hah)

Id like to walk, its so beautiful here. So I walked for like 20 minutes and hitch hiked when I heard car
But if you start hitch hiking at the end of the village locals will stop and take you. Its worth it
This small road for trucks and locals. Just go on the hill, either way the trucks cant stop
Very lucky, but the hitchspot pretty good. Maybe go little bit closer to the center of city but stay on the main road. A truck took me, all the way to Kars.
Its not the exact spot but if you stand not too much close to roundabout and no too much far, you will get a ride in no time
Just great, had a sign to be sure
8th car
Sunday. Many people go to the lake
After about 30 cars I found the perfect match. Super kind. He offered me çai and lunch.

I was captured for many hours by the owner of the restaurant. He gave me free food, water, fruit and much more. Then he found the transport for me :)
If you can stop at the restaurant. Super kind people:)
A car had stopped even before I started hitchhiking

Good spot towards Artvin. It took like half an hour before Georgian trucker stoped for us and took us all the way to Hopa really close to Georgian borders. There is limited traffic and most of the people are only travelling between local villages however trucks are most likely going through Artvin.
Good spot towards Uzundere/Artvin or Ardahan. If you get stuck here, there is a restaurant which seemed open.
Great spot for Uzundere/Artvin. Not so many cars but there is some traffic.
Direction: Adana, Nurdagi

Direction: Adana

There is space for cars to pull over.

Direction: Gaziantep 

30 minute walk from the centre. 

Plenty of place to stop, you catch all the traffic going west.

Direction: Şanlıurfa, Mount Nemrut.

You can get there from the minibus station right in the city centre (Balıkçılarbaşı Münibüs Durağı) for around €0.50 paid in cash (currently 25TL) (the minibus has a sign for "500 Evler Cd".
Good spot towards Dyiarbakir. We got picked almost immediately.
Good spot towards Diyarbakır. There’s a lot of car and truck traffic here, and it didn’t take long to get picked up. We got a ride to Siverek.

The end of the city, you can get there with public bus M6 (and possibly others) for €0.50.

Super easy to get a ride and high chances of getting invited for a tea or breakfast :)
Didnt even thumb and a car brought me east out of Istanbul

Its a border town so everyone stops at the street to eat. The road is one big parking lot. Walk the main road, not the one near the boardwalk into Georgia direction and find a free parking spot for people to stop. 5 minutes took me to Kemalpasa and I had a sign that said Gürcistan.

Someone dropped me here on my way from Trabzon to Batumi. Walked along the road to find a good spot when someone buying groceries yelled over to me „where you going friend?“ (i had a big backpack). 2 minutes later I was in his car to Batumi.
We waited longer than usual for Turkish time but we ended up being in a car till Artvin. Very good!
We got a lift all the way to the Georgian border!
Bus stop where cars can easily stop. People go to nevsehir or after, took 3 minutes for à car to stop and drive us to Konya.
Good spot, people leasing Goreme have space to stop and time to see you from far away.
Got a ride heading to Ankara almost immediately. Quiet but common route, especially on a weekend. Solo female.
Got taken basically immediately by a young local gendarmerie officer who smoke very good english. Very nice area.
Got here by minibus from Taşköprü. Not much traffic. Saw another local hitchhike as well.

I got taken here by some nice locals and got another long ride almost immediately. We had to spent some time in Kastamonu where he had an appointment at the hospital. He got me some food and later showed me some incredible ancient ruins in Pompeiopolis / Taşköprü.

After waiting for 20 minutes at the roundabout I went to just behind the split towards the university. Better spot, as people won't think that you want to go there. Got a very long ride in just ten minutes as well as some tea and food.
Good traffic and space at this intersection. Got a ride by a nice guy to Gerede.
got from here to edirne, with one ride. enough space for cars to stop
picked up in 15min with 2 bicycles!!
me and a friend got picked up by a tow truck (whilst with 2 bikes).
There is some space for people to pull over on the road in front of the gas station, fast traffic but got very lucky and got picked up in less than a minute by a driver going straight to Istanbul
Most of the vehicles are heading from the highway to the city center. Easy place if you want to get to the city centre from the highway.
A lot of trucks coming out of town. Easy to find driving a long distance.
Hitchhiked directly on a road in front of gas station. After a while a truck driver took me to Istanbul. Seems easy. December 2024.

İ walked down south after the buses H2, M7A, M11, TR20, TR21 last stop - Cezaevi and intersection to Eskikale - and got a direct ride to Nusaybın after 1 minute. You can also try hitchhike from the upper intersection going north to Otogar or south to here, but there's more busy traffic.

This is Dara (Zindan) I don't know why map says Oğuz. Full of tourists even in December so you can hitchhike back to Mardin. There is also bus B2 at 15 and 7 if you sleep here, 1.20$ with prepaid card.
You can go to Deyrulzafaran monastery after Dara, just choose which road to take as the first is shorter but no shop, while the northern one crosses Eskikale village. MardinKart app says bus B7 goes to the monastery but drivers disagree.

Deyrulzafaran monastery. 3$ entrance. Most of cars are families who don't pick up solo males. They made me walk all the way back to the main road but i believe you can be luckier than me. You can ask people in the parking lot.

These cities in the southeast see their population growing very fast so a lot of more people driving and sometimes longer waits. If you have money in a prepaid card take bus B7 from Otogar or Meydanbaşı to Ortaköy (14tl) then hitchhike to Dara or Nusaybın. Full bus route to Dara is bus B2 from Devlet Hastanesi at 12 only, 45tl, comes back at 3pm and 7am. You can use it to get closer to Nusaybın road.
We got a ride to the intersection going south to Malatya and west to Kayseri, but overall you can find a direct ride to Kayseri or more west as many trucks are arriving from East.

Ordu province -> Niksar -> Şarkışla -> Cappadocia. All drivers didn't recommend the Ünye -> Niksar road because, despite Maps shows it as a wider one, it's in bad conditions during winter. So we changed car 3 times, received a nuts bag in Korgan, got a comfy infrastructure truck to Niksar. He said don't go to Sorgun (Yozgat province) -> Nevşehir but keep on the Tokat->Şarkışla (Sivas province) -> Kayseri road, but avoid to hitch it at night because of the cold. 
Above all, wonderful scenery!
Amazing spot. I was only going to Edirne but my driver was going all the way to Istanbul. Aim for cars, not trucks.
Perfect spot for Oludeniz, got picked up after a few minutes by a motorbike at 8AM. Don't be afraid of the lack of a helmet since locals don't use them either
2 cars stopped we waited for the third one took us far
never had to wait more than 3 cars, even when we were 3 people we found a ride easily. Just near the bus stop
I live in Kırkareli. When I go to Istanbul from Kırklareli, I use this point to hitchhike. Hitchhike after oil station is good because slow cars can get you easily.
Right after toll. Lot of place to stop. Just with thumb. Got ride closer to Samsun
Perfect to be seen by drivers and very good to stop for any kind of car or truck. Ifyou want to go to georgia or artvin
Was easy, a guy on motorbike gave me a rapid ride. Nice memory
Lmao, got out of the airport through scammers on taxi, got to this spot and first car stopped, waited in total for 0.0001 seconds and got directly to Alanya. Best luck ever
Cars coming fast, not much place to stop, but this whole region in Turkey is very good for hitchhiking and we were picked up immediately anyway while we were walking.
İşlek bi yol her geçen ya Eskişehir ya da bursaya gidiyor bazen istanbul hiç yarım saat üstü beklemedim
There is a big place to stop, right before the road splits. Within 3 minutes, two cars had stopped; one was going to Tavas, the second was going to Antalya.

We took bus 729 to the last stop Atakoy from Menderes for 14 liras in 2024. Walked out to main road going to Ephesus, a car stopped soon going to Ahmet Beyli but driver was very kind and took us even closer.

Ended up waiting for 40minutes, but it’s an amazing spot. Basically all the traffic from Adana and southeastern Türkiye headed towards Istanbul takes this road to avoid Antalya. Tons of diverse traffic and great pull off area. Right after a traffic light (even though it’s a highway) so there’s tonsss of time for cars to see you. Got a ride headed all the way to Istanbul but I was just going to Isparta
The traffic in Istanbul's direction is very very small but every car that will be after border control gonna take you, so finally it works perfectly
You can just stand on the side of the road here, there is plenty of space for cars to stop and they aren't that fast yet. Great spot for the direction of konya
To Bursa, enough space
To west
Got a truck to Kars
gas station where there is space you can get car going to Mardin easily
To Mardin
To urfa using local road, maybe it is better than highway
Easiest way to get out of Antep, to Urfa, local drive may take you futher away from the city
to Antep, good spot
after the traffic light, To Gaziantep
To Kayseri, even local hitchhike here, good spot
To Nevsehir
To Cappadocia, good spot after traffic light, even truck has enough space to stop
To Konya, 5 mins waiting
to Fethiye
5 mins, great spot, cars are slow because of the traffic light, lots of space for them to stop
gas station on the main road that going to the south, Izmir or Aydin, easy to hitchhike
going to the city centre of Canakkale
many space for hitchhikiing, car stopped in 10 seconds, direction to Canakkale
Easy spot, got a ride to Marmaris.
Very easy, got a ride toward Mugla.
Very easy along this road. Got a ride without even really trying to!
Very easy, got a ride to Siirt.
Great place, also locals asks for ride here. Got ride to Konya

We took the ferry from Istanbul (Yenikapi) to Yalova to HH our way south. There is a big bus stop at this spot, so perfect for cars to pull over. Lots of traffic, but we (couple, late 20s) still had to wait an hour for the first car to stop. They took us all the way to Kusadasi, which is even further than we planned for the day (originally we planned to get to Izmir). PS: We used a sign saying Bursa/Izmir and we can't really tell whether it's better to have one or not
Good spot with a lot of cars passing. First two boys were picked up and five minutes later a truck stopped to let two hitchhikers out and I took my chance to hitchhike on that truck.

Gas station, a lot of people. Go and ask them directly. You can climb from the fences and get there from the road that passes by. Since it's highway, you can't cross normally. Go under the highway, and climb the fences.
Hatay people is super nice. Easy to get hitchiking everywhere
Traffic lights, go and ask cars
Super fast. City of Friendly People
Good spot but I don‘t know how to get there by Bus. But when you once arrived there, it is really good. Cars are going slow and they can easily stop. I got a direct lift to Denizli.

Good spot to Izmir and south. There are not so many cars but you just have to wait until you will find someone to Izmir. You can also ask the drivers directly. There is also a bus station directly at the spot.
A bit dangerous but people don't go so fast if you are at the beginning of the curve. Perfect to go to Nigde! We get a ride directly
Lot of cars and not too fast after a red light
Lucky to find a car to Antalya! Cars can stop easily!
Works great for long distance towards Istanbul
first car stopped, and tok us to Konya
We've got a ride directly to the ferry terminal to go south to Bursa/Izmir.
one of the best spots average time 10 seconds
To Istanbul
Trakya zone(Edirne, Kırklareli, Tekirdağ) is very good for hitchhike.
Great spot, city buses from Isparta take you right there. There’s a pull off area and tons of traffic
We were catching cars in four persons. About 10 minutes. Easy
It was Sunday afternoon and we waited for a bit longer, 1 hour
First car stopped after 1 minute!
Is perfect place for taking cars to Istambul, Denizli, Ankara,...
Not a lot of traffic but we got a ride eventually in a nice old Turkish car. Got offered lots of smokes
the first car took me to Yusufeli
It was hard to find a car going further than Sakarya but in the end I was taken until Düzce
Got picked up by a Trucker to a very bad spot in front of Bolu. Had a sign to Bolu.
The first car stoped to us. If you want go to Kayseri - its a best place
People stop here, but don't go any far. But managed to make additional 40km in one ride
Get a ride to Konya from here.
Sign for Goreme had us waiting for seconds before a ride to Akseki.
Got a ride after just 5 minutes

Main roads to Ankara, Aksaray and Kayseri meet at this spot. Plenty of shade and places for cars to pull over. 3 different hitchhikers going to the 3 different cities got picked up here within 10 mins of each other.
OK spot in general to Mardin
To Mardin.
Fine spot. I got a ride to Side in 15 min.
Good place for hitchhiking in the eastern direction.

Okay spot but took me a while to find a ride. Continuous flow of cars and pretty fast speeds. Tried just a thumb, a sign saying "100km" and finally a sign "Merzifon". Eventually got a ride 50km onwards to a gas station.
direction to Istanbul or Amasya, good spot
Direction to Ankara. Nar a gas station. Some place to pull over and the traffic is not too fast here.

Very busy big road, but works great.
Got a ride towards Gebze got out at a Service station.

A local hitchhiking friend showed me this spot and it works great. Tried it twice from here, the first time I got picked up to Gebze in about 15 minutes, second time it took me a little longer but in the end I got a ride all the way to Bolu.

Probably the best place to leave Istanbul towards the east. You won't catch all the traffic like at the toll gate but you also don't risk being sent away by police. Use a sign for Bolu and people will also offer you shorter rides, make sure you get one at least to Gebze as just before that is the first gas station on this road.

Lots of cars, but it took a while to get a ride. 

As you keep walking down the road, the sidewalk will at some point finish and a shoulder with good pull over space open up.
I was a bit after the curve with a sign Bursa and then Gemlik, I waited about an hour and a half before the most beaten car stops thanks to the sign.
Catching to Bursa is the easiest way, cars driving fast, but have place to stop, on places before os used only for locals, taxis and buses
good spot to Konya, new road in good condition
Place is really good to stop, but there is not many traffic, i caught ride to Baysehir
Decent space, enough traffic
Perfect spot towards Bursa. With a sign we easily found a truck driving us in the late evening. Two males.

This is the best place to HH through south from Istanbul. Most of the cars and trucks are taking the ferry from Eskihisar and there is only one road passing through here so very likely to get on in half an our ...
Anywhere on the road. But try to be here in the morning, its Very quick
Walking on the road out of town I caught a ride direction Ardahan.
We were a couple around 20s and wanted to go to ayvalik. In general, three cars stopped , two for balikeshir and one to bursa so we went there. we had a sign also that said ayvalik/bursa.
Very good spot. Took a ferry from Istanbul (Yenikapi) to Yalova to hitchhike to the south. It took 15 minutes to catch a car.

April 2022. After a whole year travelling across Turkey and learning how to become a nomad while waiting for Iranian border to re-open as well as escaping pandemic, after a whole winter in Georgia. Finally i came again to Doğubeyazıt and got a relaxing ride by a truck. I was so excited and speechless that i even fell asleep on the way to Gürbülak. You have to leave the car and walk through the border, that's quicker. I found the same truck on the other side and they hosted me in Marand.

Let t
As usual: just walk to the edge of town and start hitchhiking from there. Easy.

This is the spot you can use to get out of Turkey to Bulgaria. My experience in October 2021 was rewarding. I came to the border gate and the officials said "you can't walk" (it's been like that for years) and when I stood up few hundreds metres before, soldiers from Jandarma told me to get backwards and try asking at/inside restaurants. This doesn't work if you, like me, look Middle Eastern so the truck drivers will ignore you thinking you're irregular. So I took a dolmuş back to the pinned gas

For some reason (to get the traffic from all the rest places) I walked 10 km from the boarder to this place. A truck picked me up after a couple of hours and brought me to Istanbul. Most of the traffic is going to Edirne though.
One way to Camlihemsin or further into the National park, scenic road
Going to Kackar national park, pretty easy road at least till calimhemsin and ayder after just walk!
Very easy spot to catch for Izmir ( Friday ~13)

gas station on the way to the ring highway. good for all directions. 

take a bus to Bursa Sehirlerarası otobüs terminali. walk back to the main road, cross it and follow the road until you see the shell gas station.
Got a ride with a very nice guy who spotted us. A good place to leave Istanbul towards east with a lot of cars
Easy to hik out of Istanbul. But if you are heading east at least take a ride until Izmit.
Hitching towards Ankara. Not much traffic, so hitched on the motorway 200m before the parking. After 1h we got a ride to the next gas station. Two guys. Sunday afternoon in Febrauary.
Hitchiking to Ankara, waited less than 10 minutes, great spot.

I hitchhiked there in Sunday and traffic in the parking was only a little. I tryed hitchhiking after the parking- no results. Finally I hitchhiking 200 meters before parking (in the motorway) and I got a lift to Izmit.

Horrible spot. You have to stay next to a bus stop and only traffic from a certain part if town goes there because the main road, which is only a few feet away but highway with nowhere to stand and fast cars is going through a short tunnel kind of. Stood there for 4 hours without result and made me use buses for 3 weeks afterwards because I thought Turkey doesnt work. Was wrong if course and later it was so easy but it traumatized me. Get a dolmus to go further south or try before the tunnel tha
Got a ride to Aksaray after just two minutes :) from there I could easily hitchhike to Cappadocia! perfect spot
Perfect spot to go south!
this way to go CAPPADOCIA, KONYA, ADANA... you can come here by bus from city center... 20 min. footstand is enough .) maybe just one car can reached to you your destination...
Walked with a sign "Edirne". Got stopped instantly by a driver asking we if I wanted to go.

Police don't let you HH where the cars and trucks lanes merge and ask you to go to the Shell petrol station where a lot of people wander around.
Choose your lane regarding traffic and try to HH before the mosque so they don't see you, it should work better.
In general a sign to Edirne to get out of the border asap is a good strategy.
We wanted to get a lift to Istanbul, what proved as impossible, at least we got to Edirne - which was on the other hand very fast.
After 20 min we got a ride to Ankara :)

It was friday in Ramadan and the border it was kind of close for trucks. We wait for 1h and only a few car was passing. But we finish to get and amazing truck that drop us in the perfect place in Istanbul
no toll booths anymore
The pay toll was demolished and so it doesn't exist anymore. Drivers go quite fast here now.
good spot to go towards europe. just waited for 20 minutes and truck driver stopped. there is plenty of space
Excellent spot. It took only 10 minutes for the first car to stop, which took me the first 20 kilometers. After that it's easy as always in Turkey. Just hitch right from the highway - no problem.

Arrived at 21:00 HHed until 01:00 went to sleep, woke up at 8:00 HHed until around 16:00 when I hot kicked out by the police, while walking away I got offered a ride so I took it. The guy wasnt even going till the next gas station but took us all the way there despite the HIGH gas prices in turkey. Our waiting time could be a result of two males from wich one is arabic and the second one black.
We did't have any problems with finding ride to Ephesus (people were mostly going there) from the city and then furter in that direction.
Exactly. just walk a bit out of town and then it's not a problem to get the first lift in your direction.

Not a great spot. You might want to walk a bit in the direction you want to  go (West, North or South) before you start hitching. Selcuk is a small town so a 10-minute walk will get you to a safer spot out of town where there's a higher chance to be picked up.
I've catched a lift even to Ephesus. Also from Ephesus didn't got any problems to stop further cars.

yea, for me people didn't stop in Selcuk either, because most of the traffic is touristic ones going to Sirince or Ephesus. 
I walked out of the town direction south and I got picked up after about a kilometer or two.
Best point to go to Isparta. You can easily catch the car directly to that city. :)
Very good spot. We were staying there for four person for 5 minutes. Very easy.
Good spot. 15 min waiting max.
Good spot. 40 minutes waiting. No shadow, consider trying location some further from the city.
for go to inside of turkey... u can go there with "dolmuÅŸ"(minibus)...

Just keep walking after rhe border and find a spot with good visibility. Not that much traffic on a weekday afternoon but eventually someone will pick you up. I got very lucky with a ride all the way to Samsun. Had a sign saying "Trabzon".

Better to walk about 100m down the road from the mosque to the parking lot. Still plenty of space to stop and not so many people, buses, and taxis around. Hitching without a sign got me a ride to Trabzon (from a driver who later decided to go to Samsun) within 30 minutes at 6 in the morning.
Used the area outside the Mosque when hitchhiking to Trabzon from Batumi. It took around 45 mins [Blog Post](http://www.hobospirit.com/hitchhiking-from-batumi-to-trabzon/)

Hitchhike around the mosque, road is wider and it's just after the border point. All kinds of vehicles commute here, and there are many trucks that go all the way to Europe even. Traffic is slow and frequent.
Another great hitching experience. Direct ride to Istanbul after 5 mins waiting, Thursday afternoon. Turkey is indeed a great hitching country.

Got a direct ride to Bartin close to Amasra after 5 mins. Saturday at noon in march.
One week later got a direct ride to Istanbul after 20 mins, friday afternoon
Direction to Istanbul

On the road before the bus stop /buses 501, 502, 527, 555, 556, 563-3 go here/
Fast traffic but someone will eventually stop.
We were picked up by a Truckdriver after a few minutes and he took us to Sivas. Be aware, cars going really fast there and sometimes they use the shoulder where you try to get your ride.
I stuck here for 45 minutes when I was going to Trabzon. Got a lift to Sivas
Anywhere along the side of the highway for hitching in either direction.  We had a sign for Trabzon and got picked up in minutes to get closer to our destination.
Nice place to go to the east
Nobody stoped to greece direction
Çanakkale yolu için en iyi otostop yeri.
note that going to Greece - put Yunanistan on your sign (turkish for Greece) for locals to understand it more

going towards Greece, you get all traffic going around the town here. Before the bridge there is some place to pull over, in 2012 there was a construction site so cars drove slow, people stopping for us every couple of minutes
Nobody stoped. Get a ride only to Edirne
Nobody stoped. Get a ride only to Edirne

Good spot, but I had a local gypsy hang around and try to talk to me which made it appear we were hitching together.  Only got a ride when he moved on, but still  managed a lift to Istanbul in under an hour.
Border crossing hitch spot on the Turkish side.
I wouldn't hitch here, it's only a feeder lane for the main highway, full of buses. Walk down 5 minutes west and you'll get to a much better spot.

To anywhere in the West.
Walking distance from the center.
Cars go a bit fast and my driver had to turn around to pick me up the second try. Otherwise good spot for going to Georgia. After 20 minutes picked up to Ardesen.
Good place to hitchhike suggested by our CS hosts, there's space for the cars to stop. We waited 2 minutes with just a few cars passing.
Fine spot to Istanbul, but not too much traffic and most cars are going pretty fast. But as usual in Turkey, that doesn't really prevent them to stop.
less than 5min got a local car to half way to Istanbul
To get here, take bus 1 from Edirne to the bus station (otogar) and walk from there. Use a big sign as cars are going pretty fast.
Good spot for Greece (direction Kesan) or Canakkale
We got a ride very soon. It is good place since you are out of the city traffic and get the trucks heading toward greece.
Hitchhikers can use the road where is in front of the last stop of Silivri public buses.
Early morning, got a lift to Kayseri
Quiet early in the morning, but still managed a ride to Kayseri in under 5 minutes.
Crossroads, plenty of place to stop. Not much traffic on a quiet sunday morning.
Rides down to Olympos are no problem. Also, if you wanna catch a ride to Antalya or to the south just stand on the highway. Easy.
It's a nice place, but if you go from the olympos-beach around 6 kilometers north above this hill, you'll find a nice silent beach, not so crowdy as the beach in olympos!
Hitchhike to a perfect vacation place for hitchhikers: Olympos.
Not much traffic, but still a relatively short waiting time for lifts north.
Agree. we got lift after 20 minutes to Uzundere
There are not so many cars, but it's the only way to go to Artvin or Georgia. very friendly local people.
roundabout, very good spot

Maybe harder at night ? 
Locals hitchhike here to.
Got a lift to Ipsala and then walked to the border.
At the intersection of  the Greece-Istanbul and Cannakale-Erdine roads. Traffic lights. High visibility. Plenty of space for cars and trucks to pull over. I got a lift to Xanthi, Greece in 5 minutes.

Decent spot. I stood before the ramp rather than on it. Got here with few rides from Göreme. Cars go very fast but there's room to stop and there's enough of traffic. Tried first with a "Ankara" sign and after that thumb. Got lucky with a direct ride to Istanbul.

Direction: Ankara.

Got a direct ride to Ankara with a Kurdish family very quickly.

Direction: Adana.

We got a ride very quick, but it was very short.
Good spot, people can stop safely
Make sure to find a ride to the first gas station or resting place. We were dropped off at a shitty place

To Aktaş georgian border. Firstly i tried to hitch at the small bus station traffic lights where very welcoming men offered me çay, then i came to this intersection where discount markets are. A young guy tried to help me at the same time a truck driver walking by offered me a ride. He later found me in Kartsakhi the first georgian village and took me all the way to Tbilisi via Kashuri.

Getting a ride to Kars is not easy. I chose for the route via the lake. This works in weekends at the end of the day because they’re people spending time at the lake. 

Otherwise I think it is better to take the northern route
It still been a good place, however it is a highway and the cars go fast, we wait for 20 min

Good to hitch towards Gebze/Izmit and the Yalova ferry (to go south towards Izmir and the southern coast). Just get out of the metro stop, cross the big road on the bridge (read the road signs  to make sure you're in the direction of Gebze). There's a place that is good enough to stop just after the interchange. There's a lot of traffic though, so probably only cars going on the right lane will be able to stop.

This spot is placed in a weird location on the map, but it sounds like it's the same one where I've been hitchhiking. There was a gas station and traffic lights, I hitchhiked there a bit after 6pm in November so it was already dark - the first truck to pass by stopped, but driver didn't see me coming to him and drove away. Second truck to pass by stopped as well, and then I was taken to Göcek but the trucker himself was heading all the way to Antalya.
u can reach dalyan from a side and fethiye from the other
no shadow, but busy traffic, so you gonna be fine. (o:
you can arrive to ANTALYA with one car... not so much waiting more less 20 min... if you wanna stand in here you need to take a bus from city center to Dutlu Cad... but you need to little bit walk...
Just after the border, a family from Romania was picking us up and we had a direct ride to Istanbul. Maybe just luck because there isn't so much traffic at this place!

Good starting point to go Konya and if you need some food, there is a backery nearby they have good simit! 

We've got a car within half an hour and it took us to the little town, called Cay(southeast of Afyonkarahisar). From there we were lucky and got a ride directly to Konya.
Good spot to go south direction Aydin or further to Denizli and Pammukale.
We were really lucky with our Trabzon sign and got a ride almost to Erzincan.

Direction east. There is plenty of space for cars to pull over and a lot of traffic (even though a lot of it is local). If you use a sign make sure to choose a couple places close to eachother and not just your end destination as far-bound traffic is rare (my sign said Erzurum and it took me 2 hours to find a ride, so write Zara and from there use Erzincan and then Erzurum).
Come with bus from yenibosna, Istanbul.  It was good point even 2 male. we wait 10 min and we took ride
Stood here twice, both with a sign for Batumi. The first time got me a ride to Of within 20 minutes, second time a ride to Batumi in about 45 minutes.
Turn in for a truck stop.  Traffic moving pretty fast, but stand at the start of the lay-by and they'll see you and stop.  We got a ride to Hopa with a sign for Batumi after about 5 minutes.
This is one of the most luckiest places to go East and South. If you're not able to reach there, you can try couple kilometers back.
FERKVAR BİNA VE EKİPMAN SERVİSİ
Walk outside the town of Pertek to find a good spot. Most rides go all the way to Tunceli.
A classical place to hitchike to go to Kent Konut and also high possiblity for Umuttepe (Kocaeli university).
There is a bus stop here which is easy to hitchhike south from. We hitchhiked from here to Cappadocia.
There is a sliproad (not seen in this map) aproximately 40 meters long. cars can pull over there. Also a small shop with fruits and vegetables is there ;).
At the last metrostation "universite". Cars go fast but there is a very long pull over for cars and good visibility.
gas station on the main road towards Istanbul
lots of space to stop. accessible from town via one of the bridges
Got a ride to Niksar but after driver asked for a money.
Near bus station located road to the east - Niksar
Quite quiet on a Wednesday afternoon, but we were picked up in under five minutes with a sign for Trabzor.
Easy to get a ride, although there were not too many cars passing (this is a secondary road, but the shortest distance north).
Space for drivers to pull in for hitching East out of the city.  A sign for Goreme had us picked up in minutes.
Sign for Antalya.  Picked up in seconds - but it was a heavy trailer, and it took an age going over the mountains.  Don't take a big rig if you can help it.
4 people. 1 girl, 3 boys. about 1 hour.
Managed two offers at once after waiting for an hour with a sign to Izmir.
Gas station just down from the Troy turn off.  Plenty of traffic, and room to pull in, but it's very fast.  Caution advised for rides anywhere South/North.
Gave a ride to Turkish young woman, she said she waited less than 10 minutes. This happened in November 2013.
Hitch a car here to get to the ferry to Bozcaada, a beautiful island (used to be half Greek)
If you want to leave Istanbul, there's a streetlight there where you can find cars that can drive you to the E80 Highway.
Good spot to go south

Very fast traffic, bus stop and some place were cars ca stop.
Hitchiking to Eskiseir or to the highway.
Good place for hitchhiking in the direction of Ankara.

Good place for hitchhiking in the direction of Ankara, Istanbul.
The traffic is very fast but there is some road/parking on the rigt where cars can stop.
Direction Batumi
Direction Samsun.
Direction to Sivas. When i ve been there were only a few cars on the road. I arrived here by tram from city.
Hitch directly on the highway to catch as much traffic as possible. Cars go pretty fast but you'll eventually get a ride
Good place to get a ride to Ankara. The D300 is the best road to Ankara. The D765 goes towards Nevsehir airport and also leads to Ankara.

Used this spot after I camped near by, only took 5 mins to be collected, I was heading for Veliko Tarnovo from Istanbul [Blog Post](http://www.hobospirit.com/hitchhiking-from-edirne-turkey-to-veliko-tarnovo-bulgaria)
Possible to hitchhike. 100m after the bridge. Direction to the BG border
A Metro restaurant, open 24/7, petrol station, nice place to hitchike to Ankara, waited for 15 minutes, truck took me, about 11pm
Works for both directions. Wide road shoulder for cars to stop and traffic lights to slow them down.
A minivan stop for us to Kas after about 15 minutes waiting.
A quite good spot to go direction Kemer/Olympos (D400). It's possible to walk to this place in less than an hour from Antalya city center.
I waited for 20-25 mins. (from Ada Camping to the center of Bozcaada)
Plenty of space for cars to stop and you can get here by dolmus (minibus).
It's good place to go to Istanbul or Ankara.
It's so good place to go to Zonguldak way and the other way. Specially if you want to go to Istanbul or Ankara you can find a car easily.

To me, this is the easiest way to get out of the city to go to south.
Take Izban for 2 TRY to Cumaovasi direction. Get off at the last station. Walk for 700 meters.
The road is busy enough, there is space for cars to stop.

Got to this petrolstation around 10p.m. The guys were really helpful gave us coffee altough nobody spoke a word in english. A bunch of teenagers took us with their car hrough lueleburgaz and left us beside the road. It was completely dark but we managed to get a ride directly to istanbul

Just put out your thumb or  sign saying bodrum - waited for no more than 15min. Good spot to get an the peinsula / going west. easy to reach afoot from the citycenter. Literally you can just stand anywhere beside the road and put your thumb out - somebody will pick you up. Keep the small metrobusses in mind, they do stop frequently right in front of you - just deny getting on to it.

Direction west towards Ankara. Enough space for drivers to pull over. Not much traffic leaving town and hardly any trucks (most of them seem to go South towards Kayseri). It's a long 45 minute walk to here from the city center.
Hitching spot on the road side. Bus B1 (1.5. TL in Oct. 2014) goes to Aziziye from Erzurum. Walk 200 meter from where the bus turns around and start hiychhiking.

Mostly trucks, yes. But if you walk for 20 (or so) minutes you pass the first village and you might catch a ride with a local car going to Dogubayazit. Maybe it's a good idea to make the money issue clear before you get in a car, as some cars might be taxis...
There are just Trucks but they are really happy about kompany! The most of them are going to ankara.

Good spot on the road side. Easy to find a ride in all directions (east towards Kas or west towards Fethiye). It's walkable from Patara beach, but a passing car will probably give you a lift when they see you walking...
Pay-tolls. Direction to Edirne/Bulgaria.
Direction to Trabzon with some place to pull over before the road from Artvin joins
There was very little traffic sunday around noon. Even worse there was no place to hide from the sun along the road. Got a truck to Edirne after around two hours.
After the border, you can easily get a truck straight to Istanbul. Just wait, or ask the drivers (you won't wait more than 10 minutes)
to Nevsehir
to Kayseri
As always: walk to the edge of town and start hitchhiking. Not much traffic but possible of course. Direct lift to Hasankeyf after 20 minutes waiting.
Not that much traffic in the direction of Midiyat, but feasible. Walk to the edge of town and start hitchhiking.
As usual: walk to the edge of town and start hitchhiking. Not a problem to get a first ride.

Good spot on the highway for rides south or north. Simply stand on the shoulder of the highway. To get here it's a 45 minute walk from the city center of Bergama or take a dolmus to the otogar which is close to here.
Agree! Petrol station is a good spot. Direct lift to Artvin in 20 minutes.
God spot. There is petrol station. We got lift after 30 minutes to Artvin.
A bit back on the Kars-Erzurum highway it's also a good enough spot for rides towards Erzurum.

Road to Igdir

Good spot, as some trucks are stoping here in this gas station
No problem to get a ride from here towards Van.
Walked to the edge of town to hitch to Van.
No problems to catch a ride to Batman from here. Good spot.
Walked across the bridge and hitched towards Batman

Maybe a better spot for rides south is simply on the highway a couple of kilometers further on. Simply stand on the shoulder of the highway. To get here it's a 45 minute walk from the city center or take a dolmus to the otogar which is close to here.

to Dikili, Ayvalık, Canakkale...
Mostly people ride to small towns as   Dikili, Ayvalık etc but u can use them to make the trip shorter.
direction to Ardahan and Posof. Good visibility, friendly locals. There might be no enough shade here if you hitchhike in summer months. Overall, okay place.

Direction east. From after this intersection all the way to where the highways merge again, there is plenty of space vehicles to pull over. Either get a ride to the main highway here (thumb and ask for 'otoban') or make a sign and walk towards the highway while showing it to passing vehicles. There is a petrol station a bit down the road.
Good spot for heading to the Iranian border at Saray. Not much traffic though, don't start very early in the morning before 7 or 8.
There is a high chance you will be dropped off here as it's the junction for Agri and Kars. Just walk for a few minutes to go outside the town, it's not a very big town.
I was waiting about 30 min to catch the car directly to Izmir
good spot for izmir or menemen. it is the only way out.. there is a huge tree at the corner, stop under it, get shaded and hitchhike.someone will stop soon.

The spot is located beside a petrol station, but on the road. The road is wide at this point and there is a chance for the cars to stop. I hitched here during the winter and the staff of the petrol station gave a glass of hot tea for free in order to keep me warm.

Great place to start hitching north towards Bergama and Canakkale. You don't need to start HHing in Izmir. Just take the metro (Izban line) and get off at Aliaga station. It is cheap and it will save a lot of time.

To nearby sites :Ayvalık, Bergama (Pergamon)

and far, Çanakkale(Troya), Edirne (Greece  and Bulgaria border), Kırklareli (Bulgaria border)

Just landed in Izmir and need a ride south? You can start HHing at the airport. Even taxi drivers may help you and take you until the Izmir-Aydin road. There you can start HHing south; however solo woman travelers should beware as there are women waiting at the side of that road (Izmir-Aydin road heading south), you can be mistaken. You can also HH if you're going to the city centre but there is a metro station at the airport, which is a cheap option.
enough cars to go to west.
enough cars to go to malatya, you should be little lucky.
the only way to go to Midyat from New Mardin. Enough traffic to hitchhike, and you can always find somebody to take you.
Easy to go to Bogazici University Saritepe Campus.
Better place then Kaya Ramada Plaza Hotel. I had waited there maximum 30 minutes.
Good place to go to Kumköy/Arıköy/Zekeriyakör/Bahçeköy. I just waited 5 minutes and found a car. I think it's better to wait after bend.
transport slows down when one lane turns into town center. we get a lift from here to Samsun
to the east, transport slow down a bit because it is a town
to the east
on the road in front of the fish store, there is space for car to stop, but the transport is a bit quick here.

It's very easy to get from Mugla to Akyaka or Marmaris. Just take a bus from Mugla to Mugla University and cross the street. There's a bus stop, you can just stand there and hitchicke. Normally it's around 5min of waiting

Good to hitch towards Gebze/Izmit and the Yalova ferry (to go south towards Izmir and the southern coast). Just get off the metro stop, cross the big road on the bridge (make sure you're on the road with signs towards Gebze). There's a place that is good enough to stop just after the interchange. There's a lot of traffic though, so probably only cars going on the right lane will be able to stop.

If you're planning to go westside, Mersin or even further, you can hitchhike from this point. This is the entrance of the highway near from the first class apartments. So it is safe to make hitchhike because they will try to understand you. But on other points they may not trust to you. So here is good!

İ waited maybe 25 there, and İ spent 10 minutes eating melon with a young melon-selling lad who offered me some. Anywhere along this broad highway will do. There is place for cars to stop without worry (for them and you).
There is one problem; make sure to ask the driver if he goes to the EXACT place you are saying, and ask him if he is taking you FOR FREE.
My story goes like this: a guy stopped, picked me up and stopped at Viranşehir. He asked me for 10 lira. İ nearly fought with him to make hi
not easy as many buses going along the way and drivers expected us taking them. We were pick up after half hour to Kusadasi
Best place to go Muratlı or Edirne.

In the center of Rize either you try to get a ride on the local road to get out of the city to the east or, as we did, you can get onto the bridge at the intersection with the ramp and stay inbetween the ramp and the highway to maximize the chances. The drivers have a small place to stop on the side of the highway.
This is a good spot for hitchiking from Samsun to go to western part of Turkey. To go here, take a tram and stop at university durak, and then walk a bit.
Only waited 5 minutes with my 2 friends with 200 liters load.
It is a good place for cars to stop. They can easily spot you.
there is no place for cars to stop. It is senseless.

it s perfect place to go bursa, istanbul, izmir, kÃ¼tahya, canakkale...eskisehir students get used to HH from there...also easy to arrive...u can take tram from city center if your bag is heavy...just stand near the bus station...
Çanakkale için en iyi nokta.
Tekirdağ'a gitmek için en uygun nokta. Geceye kalmayın gece durmuyorlar. :)
Işıkları kullanabilirsiniz veya 100 metre ötedeki Barış ve Özgürlük Parkı'nın önünde otostop çekebilirsiniz. En fazla yarım saatte dururlar.

The best spot to find a ride to Istanbul. Road connection slows down the every ride. Take the number 2 bus from the bus station from the city center. Leave the bus at the Maxi Market, you have your spot

Good spot to get in direction Aydin. 

I waited about 20-30 minutes until I got picked up. Cars can pull over quite easily, because there is a big space at the right side. There is lots of traffic from 3 directions, but for some of the cars it might be hard to see you as they are just turning there. 

Also Cesme might be possible, but they tend stay on the left side of the road which might make it a little harder for them to pull over on the right side.
Very good spot to get in direction antalya. a lot of traffic, good to stop! you can get there by dolmos (pamukkale university)
very good spot in direction edremit, izmir, east-south-turkey
You can carhike just before tunel. Its pretty eary, we got lift to Trabzon after 1 hour. (Dont forget to visit stony beach nearby)
Less than 5 min...
Little traffic (at least during April)... Expect to wait for quite a long time when heading east to Iznik here.
This point for towards Yalova is Good.

Not a good spot but works. There are plenty of buses and minibuses stopping so you have to move out and in maybe. Cars go qutie fast because the traffic lights are as far as 100 metres before and the road is big.
Some trucks are parked on this fuel station and I got a ride with one of them.

Last gasstation in town with ample place to hitch on the highway.

Take bus 105, 106 or 137 from Kizilay (Ankara centrum) to get here in Golbasi.

VERY IMPORTANT key place for samsun and easter of it in black sea region through istanbul. there is a turnpike spot for go to ankara or samsun way. i hitchhiked there 2 times. one was in august for samsun. i wait more or less 2 hours. other time i used there for go to ankara and i wait 30 minutes in january.
Easy place to get a ride to Nevsehir,
hitchhiking spot to the south. It's easy to walk there from the center.
Kışın akşam 9 gibi zifiri karanlıkta 10 dakika bekledim. Mükemmel yer. :)
It's next to the bus station. Just take the metro to 4. levent. It's easy to find. You'll probably stay in Istanbul after you first hitch, bus this stop is nice to get on the highway.
Right spot for Geyikbayiri. Geyikbayiri is one of the best place that has magnificent climbing routes.

Easy to find a vehicle to north direction (Çanakkale way) especially in summer. Not bad with north-east (manisa exit) also. A bit more complicated to south since there are many options but with the right starting point and right changes at central junctions you will do ;)

You should take a  metro to Bornova station, Ege University Clinic. A lot of students hitch hicke to Marmaris, good spot for Istanbul and Ankara as well. Take not more then 5 to 10 min to take a lift.
Going to zmir is easy. Most of the trucks go there.
After twenty minutes we got a truck which took us to Erciş.
Walked through town to the edge and caught a ride to Dogubayazit in 5 min.
Crossroads, ample place to stop.
Even tough to road connection, you just suffer if you are going through to south. I've waited 4 hours. so few cars going through
male solo, going to ankara old car took me for 30 min ride :(

To Ankara and the East.
The pay toll makes it easy to speak with the drivers specialy at busy times like 10am. Carrying a sign can also help a lot.
Take a bus to "Baltalimani Hastanesi" and get off at the second stop after passing under the bridge (this is the second bridge, not the first). From there turn left just after the hospital, then left at the roundabout a bit further. You will pass under the highway and there will be an entrance to it just after.

To anywhere except Iran.
There are many dolmuş and buses driving quite far out of the city on the main road. From there you'll find many trucks driving at least up to Tatvan. 
There is a military checkpoint about 40km from there, make sure you travel legally.

The way to Iraq.
walk over the river and reach out of the town. Many cars are actually taxis taking people to the border. Trucks will be for free though.

To Sirnak or even Van if you have time. The road from Sirnak to Siirt is not paved and trucks are extremely slow on it (20kmh) cars are rare on that portion. Besides, there are military checkpoints quite often. The road to Hakari is paved but has too many checkpoints.

Really good place to hitchhike to South. Just try to find a good place to stop the car. Mostly I try to stop small car, not the trucks... to be faster and it works.
I've never tried going north from here. So I don't know about that.

HÄ±tchÄ±ng thÄ±s way from  the BulgarÄ±an Black Sea Coast(namely Burgas) can be dÄ±ffÄ±cult... Not many cars on the road... But thÄ±s Ä±s a good spot... just after the roundabout  and past the turnoff towards EdÄ±rne... Good luck!

A good place to go west direction from Ankara. The cities you can find a ride are : EskiÅŸehir, Bursa or Ä°zmir. There are newly built Gas Stations in here, and enough space for cars and trucks to stop.
Any car you stop will take you to Edremit, AyvalÄ±k or AltÄ±noluk. Very nice spot if you're heading this way ...
Good spot for hitchhiking towards Adana. Hitch along the street or ask people at the petrol station. Enough space to stop.
cars have to stop, not that much traffic but nice people there.
it took us only about 15 min. to get a ride. This spot is definetlz a fast way to get out of Istanbul.
Behind the busterminal!

Walk 30min from the city center (or take a Dolmus)

The satellte is old, but in real, there is a ramp with enough place to stop and pick you up.

Direction : Ardahan, Kars

Besides, even in summer, those mountains may be very cold and it may snow. (it happened to me, but I was lucky to be picked up really fast and that the guy was heading to Kars)

You may get a ride here to Maku, but take care that the people make it for free.
Generally, drivers arriving from Turkey know the hitchhiking and would help you, but after, all the iranians don't really know about it and may ask you money.
the 1st car stopped when I tried

I am not sure is this spot exactly where I put because it was 3 months ago. I waited nearby gas station. I got a ride 30-40 km after 20-30 minutes.
