You’ll be fine I’m not sure why the other reviews say it is hard. Turkish people like hitchhikers and it would be easy to go to edirne. Me and 2 other guys waited for a ride to Istanbul and got it rather quickly after dark at 8 pm. Not a bad place to wait a long time, borders are always good and there is a 24 hour gas station to sleep if it gets cold. If you have 2 people put one in the car lane and one in the truck lane. If you are by yourself I think it’s probably similar just go with your gut
Not the busiest service station. The one's closer to Istanbul are probably way busier. It had maybe 10 cars and 4 trucks on a tuesday afternoon. But it still works.
To Nevşehir. Anywhere on this road works pretty much. Maybe even better before this towards Göreme for better visibility.
Great spot to leave Cappadocia area. Cars drive quite fast but it was still pretty good. Can get here with a bus from Göreme or by hitchhiking of course.
La dua aŭto haltis. Sed ne estas multaj da homoj. Li iris al Sakarya.

Multe da movado, mi uzis Istanbulan plakedon kaj akceptis veturon al la benzinstacio apud la transversa sekcio. La ulo iris al Ŝakoj. Eble estus bone trovi rektan veturon al Istanbulo.

Alia petveturanto el Svislando aperis, sed ne volis provi kune, ĉar li volis manĝi kaj ripozi, ĉar li preterpasis la limon piedirante de Aleksandropolo la tutan tagon. Grekio estas tre elĉerpa.
Space for cars and traffic but few stops

Direction: Aksaray, Ankara.

Seems like a perfect spot with plenty of space to pull over right after the traffic lights, but it took us quite a while to get a ride.

Direction: Nevşehir.

Not the main road to Nevşehir I think, our truck driver was going to Konya. Low traffic.

Direction: North.

We got a ride to the motorway turn off to Nevşehir with guys going to Osmaniye.

Direction: Mersin.

The spot is close to the main bus station, where you can get with public transport.
Got picked up straight away but didn’t go far
Kinda sketchy, no real place for cars to stop, but a lot of cars passing, so if you're going to Bolu it works from there
Few traffic. Saturday. At some point you find someone.
I was asking for Trabzon or Gümüşhane, got a car for the second within few minutes
A lot of heavy traffic, but a good spot for cars to stop. Got picked up very fast.

I don‘t think there is a better spot even though traffic is scarce. Sign to Gürcistan got me to Hopa after 2x45 min intervals. Stand next to the Mosque as drivers can stop there. Bus station is kind of below you for the worst case.
Trying to get towards Ayanık, not much traffic, but enough. Most either don't go very far or are full, but after a while someone will take you.
Got a ride just a bit towards a better place in ten minutes. Big road and not much traffic but also not a great spot to catch all the traffic.
Got a bus from Bolu. Someone took me just a bit to the end of town to a better spot.

After I didn't manage to get a ride at the service station up at the Highway, I walked down here to get to Bolu. Cars are not very slow, but you will get a ride to Bolu after some time. From there I took a Minibus.
Had to wait a long time on the on ramp until someone stopped, but then got a ride all the way to Istanbul as well as an invitation into a restaurant.
I first waited before the petrol station, but when I switched to the exit of the petrol station I quickly got a ride to Edirne. He invited me for some food and helped me.
Lucky ride to Inegöl 30min. before dawn.
Many vehicles (taxi and buses) from the airport, many tourists, few locals.
Going to keşan
Doblonun içinde iki tane arkadaşım gökdeniz gibi kro durdu kapı kapanmıyordu ve büyük ihtimalle uyuşturucu satmaya gidiyorlardı ama bizi aralarına aldılar süperler sizi çok seviyorum o iki kro :) <3
Not too much traffic going east in the Gaziantep direction, but people will be very much inclined to give you a ride.

Like several of these crossings with traffic lights along the coast, there is enough opportunity to stand on the road despite the absence of a shoulder since most traffic will be slow and leave the right lane at the junction (going east in this case)
Long straightaway so cars have tons of time to see you, there isn’t a ton of traffic though and cars are going pretty fast.

Somewhere here is a bis stop where cars can easily stop for you. Good spot for the direction of aksehir, the cars are a little faster and there are three lanes but standing next to the road you are safe and visible for everybody
Good spot if you want to go to Ankara! There is a space in the curb somewhere here :) since you're standing on a hill every car can spot you
Somewhere here is an exitlane where cars can easily stop for you, I got a ride almost all the way to Ankara after just 15 minutes
There is not a big space for cars to stop, but since there is a traffic light the cars aren't that fast yet, so it works well. I only waited 5 minutes for a ride to eskisehir.
To Rize
Back to Göreme
To Derinkuyu
we got drop off at this point, Ok to hitchhike to Cappadocia, but cars are fast, 100km/h, better to hitchhike few kilometers before, there is a roundabout where cars are slower.
not much cars, direction to Fethiye
Fine spot, got a ride to Muğla from here.
Not a bad spot once you can get out to it. I got a ride to Urfa in 25 min.
Spot isn't the best, but you can easily get there by the city bus. You can also stand on the bus station 50 meters before. Got ride to Nevsehir
got a ride to izmir after 30 minutes. there is a petrol station 1km away you can easily catch a ride especially in summer
It was good, side of the highway. Even truck drivers stop. Just use your thumb
We were lucky, as we went to find the good spot to hitchhike a car stopped and drove us straight to Antalya. They were on the way to Adana.

At last got a ride here, after 8 or 9 painstaking local hops and a lot of walking, with some Romanian van life types coming back from iraqi kurdistan...they were stopping here trying t buy the toll pass for the highways.
Also it isgood to hitch on pay tolls
looks good actually but all cars on the rıght lane go to a shopping center (sunday afternoon). frıendly people at the gas statıon though =)
Standing on the main road a bit further up it's not a problem to catch a ride in your direction.

Btter spot is maybe a couple of hundred meters further on, on the highway. The spot on the highway is good for rides south towards Izmir. Stand on the shoulder after the traffic lights. To get here it's a 45 minute walk from the city center. Try to hitch while walking - I got a lift to the highway, which saved me some sweat...
Anywhere on this highway is safe and fast. Myself, I've started hitchhiking from this point, it never took more than 20 minutes.
People frequently ask for money here.
Not a lot of cars but there is enough room to be seen and for cars to make a stop. There is a supermarket here as well
Better go a bit further, out of the curve so the drivers get the time to see you.
Good spot to go to Gümushane/Trabzon. It took us 10 minutes to get a ride to Kelkit and from there we've got a direct car to Trabzon.
Its closed and fences all over, dont even try to go there (bc I did xdd).
Tried with a sign for Bolu for a while, which didn't work but without the sign I quickly got a ride close to İzmit/Kocaeli as well as a free meal.

Our driver left us there. We were on our way towards Georgia. For me (Czech republic) it was nightmare. We were on 3-stream highway, full of cars.. We were really confused there but after 30 minutes autobus stopped :D Empty autobus with driver, who was going to depo in Ankara :D He didnt want money and he took us to Gerede, they he stopped bus in highway and helped us stopping cars. After 10 minutes he stopped us Truck, which took us to Erzurum :D Love Turkey
Pretty long wait, but a very nice woman picked us up and drove us to Artvin, she even bought us local fast food!

Direction to Artvin and further to Erzurum. I'm not sure if I placed marker rightly, as you should hitchhike after you pass bus station and before the road climbing into the hill. Good visibility in overall.

I was standing for 10 minutes at the exit of this rest area and two men picked me up and drove me to the outskirts of Ankara. They dropped me off on the side of the highway. This is a common thing apparently.
One young guy.
There is a big parking space, a nice restaurant which is opened 7/24, many cars and trucks stopped here, waited for one hour, about 9pm, truck take me for a ride
Waited 15 minutes and got a ride to inegöl, lots of traffic but cars had enough time to stop
it's a good spot, cars weren't driving that fast to me, but I had to wait quite long - about 30 mins. Then a car took me to Inegol

cars are going fast on the road, better ask the drivers from the gas station, direction to East

Not so much people at the gas station to ask. You can hitchhike next to the highway and a car stop after 5/10 minutes. Easy to stop for a car!
Cars can't stop so easily but since Hatay people is nice, we got a ride.
To Adana.
Fine spot. Got a ride east from here in 15 min.
It got me out of Istanbul very quickly but it's not the best spot. I couldn't figure out a better one though so maybe this is the one you should use. Sign necessary.

Not the best place to stay, eventually we got a ride of a guy that wanted to help us, but after 2 hours going around Istanbul, left us in a much worse place close to the airport. So be strict with where you want to go. Ask at least for the toll.
we just walked like 5 minutes the highway towards north there it is nit that stressy, so we got a lift (boy and girl) after 5 minutes out of Istanbul. Quite nice spot direction edirne or bulgaria!!

We got two short rides from here each about 3 minutes and then had to walk around 30 minutes to the toll station. From there we waited 1 hour and the. Got to edirne. I'd recommend this way of getting out of Istanbul.
We didn't wait more than 5 minutes here (even if it's not the best spot in my opinion, the cars drive really fast and they haven't a lot of space where stop)
It is not a bad place just wake up early (8:00 is enough)and try to look like a student

its a bad place to HH,but if u really want to get out of the town by HH, u can select this conjuction spot of most roads. The road is wide, but many space on right to stop and take you for cars. No trucks are going through here. I recommend to take a bus and go further as possible as you can.

ts a bad place to HH,but if u really want to get out of the town by HH, u can select this conjuction spot of most roads. The road is wide, but many space on right to stop and take you for cars. No trucks are going through here. I recommend to take a bus and go further as possible as you can. Maybe to  Eskihisar Ferry, about 50 kms.

Terrible place, most cars turn under the bridge, the others are too fast.
Terrible place, a lot of cars there, but they don't pay attention to you, for 45 minutes I only caught 2 cars to airport. Better to go to Aksu.
good spot in direction alanya, mersin. also a dolmus is going there but i don't know whitch one.

seems like Turkish drivers and even trucks have no problem stopping on the highway :)
The truck driver left us here (on the highway): it's not really good spot because they haven't place to stop (only in the emergency lane) and they drive really fast.

I gave up after 3 hours. 
I was on the slip road off the roundabout onto the highway 
Roadworks almost finished, new roundabout and flyover makes the traffic move very fast.
We get a lift for Istanbul, lucky day!
There isn't really any pullover space and it's on a curve. A bit of a dangerous place for cars to stop, I don't recommend it.
Gaziantep isn’t easy to hitch out. With this spot you can get out of the city relatively easy
Dont go there, the man who put the point here is just so lucky but the spot is so bad and cars are too fast.
On the side of the road there’s a small pull out after the bridge.
Turkish registration plates beginning with 34 Go to Istanbul. Once you crossed the Bridge you can Go by foot through the immigration.

A sign for Samsun got me a ride to Trabzon from here in about an hour. Cars are going fast, but this guy just stepped full on the brakes while going 140 or something, even though there was a police check about 200m down the road. Yeah, this is Turkey :D

Gas station on the D100 towards the black sea coast (Samsun-Trabzon). You can either ask drivers at the gas station or hitch in front of it (but use a big sign for visibility because cars are going quite fast).
I was waiting 1 hour to get a ride to Aydin then I gave up.
The spot is good in the parking slot. There was low traffic but nobody took me to Macka, I had to wait 60 minutes.
good point. Stay near özdilek you can easly find a vehicle
Hithchiking here to Istanbul, found ride direct to Istanbul, didn't wait more than 5 minutes, great spot :))

I decided to try hitchhike through mountains to the Black Sea cost. It was a miracle to catch a car here which was heading to Giresun. So I am lucky one. But I won't recommend you this spot cuz trafic is too small and there is a rist to stuck in the mountains.
20 minutes of waiting
There is a lane for stopping, drivers can easily see you, I was hitchiking from here to Istanbul, waited for almost 1 hour, it was raining and about 2pm, maybe bad luck that day

The guy dropped me off directly just on the highway. Pedestrians arent allowed on highways in turkey, but no matter got a ride wquite fast after 10 min waiting with a sig saying 'Bafa'. Hithchiking in Turkey is really easy, most of them are really helpful and friendly. This guy even gave me 15 turkish lira to buy me some food.

Don't think this is a good spot for hitching towards Istanbul. You are right on the highway (not straight here either!) and cars go very fast. It seems most cars are just using the ring road, but not leaving town. I had three different lifts just to get towards the toll station. Very tricky. It's probably better starting in Susuz (north of Ankara) - but couldn't find information on how to get there. Btw: the dolmuş to "Yaşamkent" (45 minutes at least) leaves from the west side of Güvenpark, whic

A good spot for Istanbul which can be reached with one bus only from the center. Take a bus or a dolmuş to "Yaşamkent" which is the last neighborhood before the highway. Ask the driver and get off as soon as he leaves the main road. From there walk up to the highway. There is no paytol, you can just stand on the road side.

Direction west. At the edge of town. After a red light and there's a bus stop where cars can pull over. There's little private traffic between here and Yozgat and hardly any trucks. Coming from Sivas: if you get dropped here, expect to wait.

Easy to walk here from the city center. Enough space for cars to stop. Lot's of local traffic though. Don't wait for a long ride - take short ones until you reach the place where the highway splits to Van or Agri. That's the better place to get longer rides in my opinion.
Most cars go toward Erzurum, but some also turn left toward Chaldiran and Van.

Stood here for 30 min until I was picked up by a non-english-speaking driver who was nice but asked me for sex. I said yok and he drove me to Milas. Didn't try any other place, but seems to be the best highway to get out of Söke.
there was not so many car but then i got a lift to Artvin.
i wanted to hh back from Cavustepe castle to Van but nobody stopped. a farmer helped me and stopped a truck for me.
i gave up after hh-ing 1 hour in the sun
Traffic to Malatya from here was slim, took met 1,5h to get a ride. Most drivers turned south or indicated they were turning north further on.
Definitely better to take the dolmus to the campus and hitch from there. Waiting time at the highway close to the campus only 15 minutes for a ride north.

Surprisingly little traffic leaving town. Was here from 09:00 until 10:45 when I caught a ride.

Probably better to take a dolmus further out of town to hitch at the University (marked 'Campus')
To halfeti.
To Gaziantep or Sanliurfa

It's not easy to HH here as most of the cars who stop for you will be cars. Try to explain them where you are going and that you are travelling without money/paying (there is no word for HHing in Iran and it's not a known concept). People are friendly, so a taxi going east can take you free of charge.

If you are going east, there are some dangerous mountain passes from this town until Erzincan. People say there are wolf attacks. Avoid any car that is going to a village a couple of kilometres away and try to find a direct ride to (at least) until Erzincan.
If you are dropped off in the city centre, you need to walk a bit or take a public bus to the end of the city. It's not common to HH around this city, so you may need to wait for a while.
Just after a traffic light, has space to stop, but the cars coming from the opposit way don't have much time to see you.
I got a ride to Erzurum from here, but also perfect towards Gümüshane. It is a bus stop with plenty of space for the vehicles to stop.
Waited 40 mins, then took a bus to Hopa (14 TL each).
Road towards Hopa. We got lift right after traffic lights. It tooks 20 minutes.
Waited more than one hour, then hitchhiked a taxi to Ardahan (25 TL altogether).
Direction Ardahan. Very low traffic.
People are nice, but very low traffic. 45 mins until Turkish people stopped (asking for money) but eventually it was free to Damal.
Direction Ardahan.
The first car stopped and took us to Posof.
Direction Turkey. Very low traffic (car every 10-15 mins).
opposite to the opera house, transport is quick here, but we manage to get a lift of of the city
we are lucky to get a lift out of Sinop from here (under the old city wall), the public transport takes another road, so here is mostly private cars. And it is Barem time

the side road is separated from the highway, we have to walk away from the flyover to the tea factory office, where there is space for car to stop, but a lot of minibus stopping as well. we are lucky to get a lift to Batumi
Not so easy to get picked up for Izmir. even if i was alone i was picked up after 20 minutes(maybe because of Eid eve)

Many people stopped but they were going not very far. We got a ride for just a few kilometres. After waiting there for 45 minutes we got invited for tea by a trader next to the streat. After that we took the the bus to Silivri bus station. It costs between 4 or 5 Tl. In Silivri you can find a good place on the highway not far from the bus station. There we got a ride within 10 minutes.
you can get there by metrobus direction avcilar
we were picked up by car-hirer back to Cesme central. We were just lucky
along the road is fine for Izmir or Cesme
we want to go to Cesme, there were also infrequent buses, so we are picked up by a car going to Izmir
we were picked up by tourists driving back to Selcuk
we are lucky to be picked up by a tour bus with passengers going back to Beskonak
One dolmuş per day comes here during off-season, avoid hitchhiking at night (no traffic, stray dogs).

It could be tough to wait for a car here. Ask locals for help, basic Turkish knowledge is essential.
---
Arabayı beklemek için burada zor olabilir. Yöre halkını sorunuz, onlar yardımcı olacaklar, arabası bulacaklar.
Dolmuş to Kumluca otogar cost 3 tl (Dec.2012)

Dolmuş from Kumluca to Mavikent stops here. You can continue from here to Karaöz, as locals prefer to use the mountain road, not the coastal one.
---
Burası Kumluca'dan Mavikent'e dolmuş durağı. Buradan Karaöz'e devam edebileceksiniz, tepe yolu boyunca daha çok arabalar gidiyorlar, sahil yolu değil.
Yarım saat içinde yoldasınız. Keşan tarafı için kullanın. İstanbul için Malkara'nın diğer ucu daha uygun.
Tekirdağ çıkışına kadar yürüyerek otostop çekmek zorunda kalırsınız. Çanakkale yolu için zorunda kalmadıkça kullanmayın.
going saklikent canyon
traffic is mostly trucks

Direction: Istanbul

Not very convenient for the drivers to stop, but we got a ride with an empty bus to the bus station in Edirne after all
Could not get a ride in half an hour, finally took a bus (10 TL, tickets for the next bus may be sold out). Almost no trucks, cars are expensive, not peasants' cars.
To Canakkale, we could get a ride on the east-bound outlet of the otogar in 5 minutes. The driver was Moldovan and told us that he regularly takes this route when going to Turkey.
from the edirne bus station to bulgaria. low traffic, people easily stop. or you can walk the 3-4kms till the motorway.
Little traffic going to Nemrut volcano. Definitely worth seeing!
Kağıthane - Şişli - Taksim - Beşiktaş'a gitmek isteyenler için iyi bir alan.
Not a good spot actually, I tried twice, at first I waited only 1 hour, but second one, 5 hours!
it s another perfect place to go ankara and east of turkey... opposite of anadolu uni. and possible to see another student hitchhiker .)
If you avoid the mini busses, you can get on a ride within 10 minutes, and Tekirdag city is a bridge between Istanbul and Greece. I always use that city center spot and it is quite good

Hitch-hiking hell!

Avoid getting stuck here on your way to Greece... there are mini buses constantly trying to pick you up and getting in the way... and the highway is straight through the edge of town... Tekirdag... how I loathe thee!

Its hard to go throug bosphourus by hitchhiking. I tried it several times and it took me about 6 cars and 1 hour to go just 15 km to my home! Better to walk or bike. Or just take the public transport.

Thats a great spot. I always use it to get out of Istanbul and 4 times it was perfect. The traffic is huge so just stick on to highway. After 2-3 cars, thats it, you are out of Istanbul! Stopping a car usually takes less then 5 minutes!

That was a poor stop, as i tried to hitchhike in the highway and there were only few cars going from the highway. It was also dark and raining. I waited around 2 hours and finally got a lift directly to Istanbul!
There is a lot of traffic there and little space to stop. I found it hard.

Take Metro from Taksim, get out at last stop (4.Levent) and walk along the street direction north for 15min. (along a miliary area). Then try to cross the big street when you see the ramp to direction Edirne! There is enough space for cars to stop!
Not bad. Once waited about 30 min, and another time about 20 min, both times heading south.

There is a petrol station and a good point for hitchhiking east to Yozgart, if you stuck into Ankara, take a bus for appr. 3 euro to Kirikalle and ask the bus driver to drop you here infront of the city.

If you arrived here, from Istanbul, it is probably because you followed what it was told on the wiki page (Train to Gebze, 1,5TL). This is not a really good place to hh. It seems like a motorway, but it's not. Nothing is lost : I would advice to take a minibus to the O4 Motorway, about 4km away. There you will probably have more chances, as evryone going east takes this road.
Traffic moves quickly but visibility is good. Plenty of space to pull over. A lot of local traffic but some long-distance traffic. I got a lift within an hour.
No shade, no really decent place for cars to pull over. But when life gives you lemons, say fuck the lemons and hitch there anyway. Waited 45 mins for a lift.

Ok pour aller à Istanbul (3 voitures se sont arrêtées). Pour aller vers Ankara, les locaux nous ont conseillé de marcher sur l’autoroute, que les voitures auraient assez de place pour s’y arrêter. Quelqu’un s’est arrêté pour nous avant que nous essayons cette technique. Aussi, je pense que ça a pris du temps car un camion bloqué la visibilité
Not a lot of cars. Visibility is ok and there is ample room to stop. Almost everyone will be going to Trabzon.
Not a lot of stops and most don’t go all the way to gürlevik.

Not a lot of traffic and most cars don’t go to Istanbul. Gas Station personnel was nice and gave me tea and advice. Look for cars with 34 on the numberplate as this is the city code for Istanbul. Stand near the highway so you’re not limited to the gas station traffic.
Couldn't even finish making my sign when a friendly guy told me to hop in. Not the busiest gas station but not that quiet either.
To Kayseri. Probably easy for Ankara. I tried both before and after the traffic lights. After there's a place to stop but many already drive somewhat fast at that point.

En mia vojaĝo al Japanio senhalti, Mi provis dum preskaŭ 2 horaj uzante la ŝildon Bolu/Ankara, inkluzive en la aŭtovojo dum kekaj minutoj, unofoje ke ĝi estis malrapida ĉar la trafikŝtopiĝo, sed mi nur estis invitita al Gebze kelkaj fojo. Mi ke kredas ke estas la plej bona. Sed vendredo postagmezo estas tre freneza kaj kaosa. Eble se tie ne fluas vi povas akepti kaj iri a la parkejo antaŭen. Sed Gebze estas nerekomendita. Sorry.

Mi nur volis eliri de tia freneza, bordela, kaosa loko. Iomete poste la enirado aĵ la aŭtovojo estas iomete pli bona.bmi ackeptis veni tie post 3 invitoj ekde la granda benzinstacio en Istanbul. Sed mi kredas ke vi povas provi iomete plu iomete pli malproksime.  Ĉi tie vendredo posttagmezi estas tro multa. Mi havis bonŝanson.

Mi ne povas bone validi tie ĉar la amiko kiu veturigis min tie helpis min trovi la kamioni kiu lasis min en la benzinstacio. La kamiono iris al Ankara sed ne volis veturigi min ĝis la transversa sekso inter ankara kaj samsun.  Do li lasis min en la benzinostacio poste Sakharya. Sed tie ekzistas multajn da kamionojn irantajn al Ankara.

Mi skribis Ankara/Samsun kaj antendis 96 minutoj. Mi kredas ke la nokton kaj la pluvon malfaciligis la procedon.  Malfeliĉe kiam ĵa amiko haltis, iranta al Anlaka, la policidtoj aperis kaj monpunis la kondukisto... My bad, sorry....

Li lasis min sub la suprenirejo. Estas facile grimpebla si vi volas iri direkto Samsun, aŭ Katvelio aŭ Armenio.

Tre malfacile dumnokte. Kelkaj homoj haltas, neniu volis paroli kun mi. Eblas, ke homoj haltas venante de la ĉefa vojo, sed ankaŭ tre malfacile pro la kurbo kaj rapideco, malbona videbleco.

Iu donis al mi 50 lirojn dirante al mi preni transporton al la sekva urbo, ĉar mi tute ne sciis kiom kostis. Mi haltigis la unuan kamioneton, eniris kaj kiam mi rimarkis, ke 50 liroj estas nur unu eŭro, la ulo lasis min ĉe la tria benzinstacio. Mi ne bezonis pagi la 50, do tio estis veturo. Sed mi preferus

Direction: Adana, Tarsus.

We had to wait quite a bit, even though it seems like you can hitch with people going both on the motorway and the free road.
Not ideal, pretty fast road but only option if went by bus and dont want to pay taxi. Just believe in yourself

Direction: Eskişehir

Lots of cars pass by, but it took almost an hour for a truck to stop and take us to Eskişehir.

Direction: Eskişehir

Cars go a bit fast, but the traffic shouldn't be local anymore.

To get there, take metro to Koru, then one of the buses suggested by Google Maps, they can get you right to the spot. As of 2025 you have to have a special card for Ankara public transportation. The two tickets cost 50TL, the card 100TL, but you can use one for more than one person.
We were heading to the main junction where the roads come together toward the north (Artvin, etc.), but got picked up earlier by a friendly guy who dropped us about 20 km before Tortum.
I waited after the exit of the petrol station and after some time only got a ride to the on ramp of the highway.
The street is very wide there so cars can stoop quite easy

The spot is ok, wanted to go to Edirne, sign on the road also says Edirne. Cars can easily stop at the bus stop. Easy to reach. Car took me directly, but dropped me off at a bad spot just outside of Istanbul… still worth a try maybe :)

Lots of vehicles, unfortunately I was at the location during heavy rain and no one wanted to stop. In the end they took me in the truck a long distance. The gas station staff is very friendly and helpful.

Cars are fast but there is place.
Sign : Rize
To a better place east

It's a massive gas station with its own infrastructure. If you talk to people you can get to Konya or even Ankara. But prepare that you will need to learn some Turkish, as nobody understood English when I was trying to speak it
cars are going fast but large space for them to stop, to Erzurum
cars are fast but they will stop, To Merkez
Not a great spot, but better than the one listed nearby. I got a ride to Aydin from here in 15 min

There is a shoulder where cats can pull over. At first we (couple, late 20s) waited about 100m before that spot (in front of the A101 supermarket), but the cars go really fast, so they didn't have enough time to turn into the parking of the supermarket. A car finally stopped at the shoulder and we realised that (a) they stopped for us and (b) that the shoulder/bus stop would have been a much better place to HH from the very beginning. The two young guys took us almost until the Bafa Gölü lake, t
Though one getting a ride coming from Georgia. I was there on a Sunday and there was very few traffic going though the border

We waited here near the night. It wasn't dark yet. No one stopped. But the people were great, there is a local coffee and a mosque right near by. We slept in the guesthouse of the mosque and spoke with the locals.
The next morning, we got a ride with the first car 😂
Not so much people stopped. Not very popular rest stop.
Okay place, cars go fast but big area to stop because of busstation.

There are many family houses near this street. Unfortunately, there are also many dogs that can be aggressive. I do not recommend the location as it cannot be safe for everyone. I recommend standing a little earlier at the gas station.
Cars are going too fast but a nice guy on motorbike drove me exactly where I needed and we shared a meal
People are cocky here on the way to Antalya, just before the tunnel. They even don't see you standing beside the road. Expect to wait hour(s).
maybe bad luck? been there for 1.5 hours, tried different strategies but was not able to get a lift to cappdocia or at least the O-21.
I tried my luck on the fuel station and got a lift to another fuel station in Golbasi after 20 minutes.
Going to "Gölbaşı" with a dolmuş (the next town) is also a good option.
This road is the main direction through Konya and Cappadocia. There are good spots on the road, but i prefer gas station exits.
for me it was also very bad. i could move very slowly to Savsat.
Waited one hour, only two cars, probably local, then took a taxi.
Direction Savsat.
huge traffic here. However, it doesn't stop good.
big traffic, but cars doesnt stop very good

We reach this place after a long hiking trip. We chosed keep walking instead of going back. I think we were pretty lucky to find a car from here. We took a ride to Söke. There was only one small village behind us. Head man of the village took us. If you really stuck, there is a small museum close to that area. The guy in there may help you...

A truck driver just left me here, in the middle of the highway. After 2 min raising my hand another truck driver took me. The place seemed to be the worst but maybe i was lucky. In turkey any place is hitchhikable
Looks like a good spot (lots of space and decent traffic). Nobody stopped for 1 hour (very uncommon for turkey) so we walked to the main road (it's a nice walk =)
Its a hard to leave Kayseri for west on this highway. Try to get to edge of the city as much as you can
Check info on Kayseri at wiki about how to get here.
There are a lot of cars but for some reason they dont stop as usual in Turkey
I was hitchiking here, very bad place to hitchike, cars passing very fast, there is a line to stop but no one did that, waited for 2 hours, after that I walked 2km and finally find a ride
nobody stopped so i took the bus
i don't know how much i walked but it was difficult to catch a ride to Kars. it's a long city. :(

Didn't try to get a lift in this direction (took the dolmus), but coming back from Altiparmak it was easy to hitchhike. There might be only one car an hour, but they stop (and in my case nobody asked for money)

If you want to go to Kackar Dagi (like we) you will probably go this way. Its impossible to autostop in this way, because this is onlyone way to Yaylalar (last village before kackar) and noone is going there, only one option is pay for dolmus. Belive me, its only one option. Dont loose time like we was. Ticket costs 25 lira one way :(
To Sanliurfa
its little hard to hitchhike here, you should be lucky.
Bir önceki yorum da bana ait. Aynı yerde 150 metre ötede işaretlediğim yerde otostop çekerseniz çok çok daha şanslı olursunuz.
Otostop çekerken kolumu hissetmediğimi hatırlıyorum. Belki biraz daha ileride görünürlük artacağından şansınız artabilir ama zorunda kalmadıkça sakın diyorum.
bus to Isparta is frequent and not expensive, many drivers just passed by

Went there and retuned back to İzmir via hitch-hiking for a day-trip. Also it was one of my stops when I was going to İstanbul. It is very crowd road and nice spots to catch cars just after the traffic lights. However, wasnot so fast to get one.

My worst experience in Turkey, I waited here 4 hours. Also some of my friend waited longer.
It seems like a perfect place. Many cars using this road. I would avoid this place next time. Maybe my dark hair and beard cause this...:)
Seemed like a good idea but traffic was insanely low. Got quite easy on this road because there some industrial park, but to get to Denizli, we had to be patient.

This is a way to leave to Istanbul if you don't want to bother taking buses to get outside of Ankara. Take the metro to "Ivedi" or "Akkopru" stations, from there you'll be on Istanbul road and although there can be a lot of traffic there, you should be picked up fairly quickly.
Very rural spot, and not a lot of traffic. A few busses might stop here, and there is also a village nearby. We got lucky with a truck shipping gas to Erzurum

I chose a less busy route, it’s good that I met grandfather. The views are beautiful. 
I think it's faster to go by road D350
Bad spot to hitchhike towards south. Try to find someone going to the ferry in Eskihisar

La plej neverŝajna loko por veturigi, pli malbone dumnokte, ĉi tiu benzinstacio estas morta, la ulo, kiu laboras ĉi tie, estas kolera pri la vivo, eble lia sola ĝojo estas nutri la multajn katojn. Mi preskaŭ estis forironta kaj iri al la sekva proksima intersekciĝo meze de mallumo por provi pli bonan ŝancon, tamen kamioneto haltis por ŝanĝi ŝoforojn kaj ili prenis min en la lasta minuto. Mi alvenis ĉi tien pro malbona vojaĝadministrado.
Not a great spot. Cars don't go far and there's a lot of trafic so good opportunity for cars to stop, even on the bus stop. Got a lift to the highway jonction by asking people

took literally all day because we had 2 bicycles with us.
Without them would've been picked up after an hour and a bit
Very high traffic, but only around the neighborhood. No driving out of town. Lots of trucks from the port, but no one agreed to drive me.

Not great. Cars come in fast and occasional chaos on the crossing leaves many drivers to focus on the traffic, leaving little room to manoeuvre and stop (southbound). Although not a great stretch of road, hitchhiking-while-walking on the road southwards turned out to be more efficient.
Not many places for traffic to stop along this road.  You may have to walk a fair way to find a decent spot.  However when you do, you should get a ride in no time.
There is a popular whorehouse somewhere near. So dont expect nice folks.
awful, never try to hitchhike here, better if you use road of kayseri
impossible to get a ride, we waited one hour but to many town cars. no one stopped
no one stops maybe because of ramadan holiday, took a bus.
İm still waiting its been 60 min maybe more i didint count there is no car going to Artvin direction also soo cold here

Our last car left us here, far from the main road.. Cant recommend: almost no traffic, the cars don't stop and we waited long just to get a lift to the next closest city (Çavdir). From there we got fast to Antalya
